rComments: One of the best profs I had. He's so knowledgable about the various social aspects shaping our lives on this planet. His lectures were so worth attending for interest. Have to study hard if you wanna do well in this course.

this guy is a class a condescending prick. he employs a lofty and pseudo intellectual vocabulary that really doesn't make a difference and is superfluous to the textbook. he needs a good ego deflation. his tests are super easy though and if you're there for the videos then you can skip the rest of the classes and just read the textbook.
he is a great proffesor

Definitely UofT's biggest loss...Dr. Colaguori is the best prof I have ever had, he can make you think like no other...He is not boring and socially-weird like the typical UofT prof, he knows how to reach out to students and it helps that he is friggin sexy!

His tests are very hard, i did so bad in his course cuz of them, although i knew the material very well, the test are pure textbook memorization.  However, i'll do anything to listen to that sexy voice all day! HOTTEST prof ever! reminds me of robert downey jr in iron man!!
Awesome prof.  Never seen anyone with as great a command of con hall as he.
Tests are HARD!! Multiple Choice and Essays and you must memorize the text rather than know the topics. Great prof - somewhat funny!! Pure GENIUS!
this prof has passion and has the abuk

Extremely approachable and overall nice professor. Goes out of his way to help students out.                 Overall, lectures were stimulating and provacative. This is one of those classes you envision attending when you think of what the ideal university experience should be about.

I love this Prof! His lectures are awesome. Really engaging. Has a nice voice. However, I feel that the his tests are set in such a way that it tests more of our memorization skills than understanding.

Deviance and Social Control, which is fascinating anyway, is a dream course with him. That was two years ago, and I still miss him. My world hasn't been the same since he broadened my horizons about ideologies. Wow.
Very approachable, even if you're shy! Answers questions by email to. Great prof, great mind. Do not skip lectures, you will definetly regret it.
excellent prof. clear, concise and fair exams. highly reccomend
all the positive ratings prompted me to write this review... he's interesting but very obviously biased
best prof i've had in my entire u of t career.

I have a hunch the person below did poorly in Colaguori's class. Nonetheless, he is an amazing prof. Cares deeply about his students success, very approachable, crystal clear about concepts, replies to his emails thoroughly and thoughtfully, organized, and TOTALLY looks like Kevin Spacey. Easily a great addition to UofT.
easily one of the worst profs in UofT. I wonder if he hired ppl to add all those nice comments. Extremely boring, and extremely biased.

The class was boring. The prof teaches well enough, but he pretty much goes over the text book (of which there were 3) and that's it. He's hot and funny but the content of his lectures was practically 0... the films were worth watching though. Read the books, he's pretty much straight from there. Tests were super-easy.
Best prof i have had so far.
Best professor  I have had so far, very good clear notes, tests are based on what he talked in class.
Very engaging, great perspective, challenging
Loved this prof. Great sense of humour, interesting reading, great films. Always available for students before & afer class, and by e-mail. Passionate about the subject,
He does his job very well. He's very interesting but tended to read from the readings a lot towards the end of the course. Overall, he was fantastic.
Loved this prof. Great sense of humour, passionate about the subject. Interesting and varied reading material, fabulous films. Always available for us before & after class, also by e-mail.

This Prof is amazing.Very helpful and understanding.Fair grader.Tests on material which is fully covered and well explained in class so it is easy to get a good grade.Passionate, especially about the Prison Industrial Complex, which makes lectures interesting.Fav prof out of four years of Profs.
I like his class so far hope he doesnt mark that hard i like that he belives in what hes teaching
No Comments

Claudio is a great professor.  Very interesting and intelligent.  He cares about the students in his class and beleives in what he is teaching, he also encourages students to think critically about sociology.   One of the best.

His lectures were super boring a lot of the time. BUt he showed awesome films in class, and he would go off on tangents in class that had nothing to do with cours material, but that were really interesting. Good course.
Excellent Prof. Grades rather toughly, but explains everything well.
No Comments

His lectures were entirely pointless - he read verbatim from the text. Good if you don't do your readings, but if you do, the lectures were absolutely pointless and boring. We're in university, we can read! We don't need to be read to. Friendly and interesting after class, but needs to incorporate that attitude into his lectures.
He's an amazing prof...he makes the lectures very intersting and worthwile, the readings are pretty massive and long but he summarizes the important parts in his lectures

This was a very interesting and thought provoking class taught by an excellent teacher. Out of all my courses this year this was the most stimulating. I learned a lot about many issues facing society. One text was boring but the other two readings were excellent. Teacher was always helpful and friendly to talk to after class.

Absolutely excellent professor with incredible insight into Social issues.  If you want to learn about Sociology, this the place.  The two poor ratings below are obviously from non-sociology majors who resent any information that causes them to think or students who don't want to work.  The course was a great learning experience.
worst prof ever. he says anything 'business' is to be resisted...what a communist. very one sided view of the world; just awful.

I look forward to this class every week!! Its like Im going to an event rather than school. Prof Colaguori is totally engaging and very helpful and makes a great atmosphere - I wish all my courses were so outstanding!! Does he teach anything else? 'cause I want in
its profs like Colaguori tha make UofT the Best!! His lectures are engaging and helpful for the readings. It doesnt get any beter

I highly dislike this class and this professor. I was originally excited about the course material but the professor is dull and only reitorates what is in the course readings. Lectures have not provided me with any insighful or interesting information. As an upper year student I can say he is easily one of the worst professors I have ever had.

As an upper year student I can honestly say this is the best course I've taken at UofT. The person with the rating below me is an idiot who probably did****ty on the last test so they're mad at the prof. Lectures are very engaging, clear very helpful. I always look forward to attending. I hear he teaches another class too - Highly recommended!!
improved your damned handwriting or start using powerpoint. Easily the worst prof. at U of T. Did U of T find him working at the Gap and feel sorry for him?
he and his lectures make my week!

this was my best course at UofT. The prof was always interesting and helpful. It was a learning experience and not a boring outflow of information like some other classes. I was sad to see it end. People on here who complain obviously didnt attend all the classes to get the full effect or they got bad marks and are just complainers. He's the best!

I know he is a sessional proff but, he was very lazy and didn't prepare a lecture and instead had us read things and then briefly reiterate a few points he thought were important.  Also was extremly unhelpful with questions about the assignment(in that he didn't remember the parts of the assigned reading that were not on crime.
No Comments

He presents things from a neo-marxist viewpoint. Colageurio is a good prof in that he knows how to make his students think, but he's also a bad one because he makes sweeping empirical generalizations about social elite, which are not backed with evidence. He believes radical stuff about world history, even though he has no proof to back it up.

Best prof and best course I've had at UofT! We covered a lot of very interesting material. No boring memorization and I really learned a lot. Prof was friendly, professional and easy to meet with. I was sad when it ended.

Very unprofessional, didn't know any of the department regulations and often lied about them to intimidate students on a one-on-one basis. He justified low marks by using the excuse that he needed to lower the class average, and was not open to correcting marks on this basis. very disappointed.
No Comments

The course subject is interesting enough itself, but this Prof made it so much better! We frequently went to talk to him after class about the lecture, and he didn't mind discussing some of the more controversial ideas. He stuck close to the text in lectures, which helped for studying for exams.
The material was very interesting. Lectures were very relaxed, but they followed the text too closely.

Very interesting course...really opens your mind.  The professor is nice.  The tests and the assignments were straightforward if you knew the material.  Overall a great course.  I just wish the class was smaller so that we could have more indepth discussions.
Great prof, with great lecturing style.  Very easy going and relaxed.  Course material was interesting usually, but he made the difficult material seem clear.  Hope to take another class with him
No Comments
No Comments

Very interesting course - lectures are great.  Explains concepts so well that they become almost common sense.  However, while Prof. Colaguori appears to apply these concepts to all aspects of society, he is extremely limiting in what he will allow his students to do for their research essay.
No Comments

His lectures follow the textbook pretty closely and he explains a lot of the tricky concepts well.  The course can be a bit repetitive sometimes, but he adds his own take which is nice and applies sociological theories to real day problems.
good prof, lectures sometimes stuck too closely to the text which was helpful with some but repetitive for others

Claudio was the best professor I have had at UofT. He knows his material, is personable, funny, and I actually really was saddened when the course was over! That has never happened, I assure you :-) I hope more courses are taught by him at UofT.
Great prof. lectures were inresting and informative. Would definitely take other courses taught by him.
Excellent teacher....I hope he instructs more courses in the future

Great prof who is not pretentious at all. Lectures were informative, interesting and entertaining. Helpful and fast with email responses and approachable in class. I can still remember what I learned from him and put it in context of current events.

Very interesting critical perspective, well prepared prof, one of the best courses I've taken. He was helpful and easy to talk with and returned all e-mails.I wish there were more professors like him around.
